ohi.andre.comparestring2

Class Compare

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohi.andre.comparestring2.Compare

  • public class Compare
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the core of CompareString2. The class Compare contains the methods used to compare String objects. 1vs1 or 1vsMany

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  Compare.CompareItem
      This class holds the result of a comparison o is the object compared to s1 r is the result of the comparison

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public static float compare(java.lang.String s1,
                            java.lang.String s2,
                            ohi.andre.comparestring2.algs.interfaces.Algorithm algInstance,
                            AlgMap.Alg alg)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the String string of the comparison
        s2 - the String string of the comparison
        algInstance - an instance of Algorithm that will be used to perform the comparison. Check ohi.andre.comparestring2.algs
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg. It must refer to the same algorithm referred by algInstance. Check AlgMap
        Returns:
        the distance/similarity between s1 and s2
        See Also:
        Algorithm

      • compare

        public static float compare(java.lang.String s1,
                            java.lang.String s2,
                            AlgMap.Alg alg,
                            java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        s2 - the second String of the comparison
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        args - a list of Object that will be used to build an instance of Algorithm
        Returns:
        the distance/similarity between s1 and s2
        See Also:
        AlgMap.Alg

      • buildComparePack

        private static <T> Compare.CompareItem[] buildComparePack(java.lang.String s1,
                                                          java.lang.Iterable<T> s2,
                                                          int size,
                                                          java.lang.String[] splitters,
                                                          ohi.andre.comparestring2.algs.interfaces.Algorithm algInstance,
                                                          AlgMap.Alg alg)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        s2 - an Iterable object whose elements will be compared to s1
        size - the exact number of elements in s2
        splitters - refer to checkSplits
        algInstance - an instance of Algorithm that will be used to perform the comparison
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg. It must refer to the same algorithm referred by algInstance
        Returns:
        a sorted array of Compare.CompareItem containing information about the comparison of each element with s1. The array is sorted with respect of the sorting order given by the chosen Algorithm
        See Also:
        Compare.CompareItem

      • bestMatch

        public static <T> T bestMatch(java.lang.String s1,
                              T[] ss,
                              AlgMap.Alg alg,
                              java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        ss - the T[] object whose elements will be compared to s1
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        args - a list of Object that can be used to build an instance of Algorithm
        Returns:
        the single best match of s1 with each element of ss, found using the given AlgMap.Alg alg

      • topNmatches

        public static <T> T[] topNmatches(java.lang.String s1,
                                  T[] ss,
                                  int n,
                                  AlgMap.Alg alg,
                                  java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        ss - the T[] object whose elements will be compared to s1
        n - the length of the returned array object
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        args - a list of Object that can be used to build an instance of Algorithm
        Returns:
        a sorted array of T of length n. The sorting operation is based on the results given by the algorithm alg

      • withDeadline

        public static <T> T[] withDeadline(java.lang.String s1,
                                   T[] ss,
                                   float deadline,
                                   AlgMap.Alg alg,
                                   java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        ss - the T[] object whose elements will be compared to s1
        deadline - the min/max rank of the elements in the array which is returned
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        args - a list of Object that can be used to build an instance of Algorithm
        Returns:
        a sorted array of T containing only elements with rank >= deadline if Utils.biggerIsBetter(alg) is true, only elements with rank <= deadline if Utils.biggerIsBetter(alg) is false

      • withDeadline

      • topMatchesWithDeadline

        public static <T> T[] topMatchesWithDeadline(java.lang.String s1,
                                             T[] ss,
                                             int n,
                                             float deadline,
                                             AlgMap.Alg alg,
                                             java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        ss - the T[] object whose elements will be compared to s1
        n - the maximum number of elements of the returned array
        deadline - the min/max rank of the elements in the array which is returned
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        args - a list of Object that can be used to build an instance of Algorithm
        Returns:
        a sorted array of T containing at most n elements with rank >= deadline if Utils.biggerIsBetter(alg) is true, only elements with rank <= deadline if Utils.biggerIsBetter(alg) is false

      • topMatchesWithDeadline

                                             T[] ss,

                              int size,

                              ohi.andre.comparestring2.algs.interfaces.Algorithm algInstance,

        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg. It must refer to the same algorithm referred by algInstance
        Returns:
        the best match with s1 within ss, found using the given AlgMap.Alg alg

      • topNmatches

        public static <T> T[] topNmatches(java.lang.String s1,
                                  int size,
                                  java.lang.Iterable<T> ss,
                                  int n,
                                  AlgMap.Alg alg,
                                  java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        size - the number of elements in ss
        ss - an Iterable object whose elements will be compared to s1
        n - the length of the returned array object
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        args - a list of Object that can be used to build an instance of Algorithm
        Returns:
        a sorted array of T of length n. The sorting operation is based on the ranks given by the algorithm alg

      • withDeadline

        public static <T> T[] withDeadline(java.lang.String s1,
                                   int size,
                                   java.lang.Iterable<T> ss,
                                   float deadline,
                                   AlgMap.Alg alg,
                                   java.lang.Object... args)
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        size - the number of elements in ss
        ss - an Iterable object whose elements will be compared to s1
        deadline - the min/max rank of the elements in the array which is returned
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        args - a list of Object that can be used to build an instance of Algorithm
        Returns:
        a sorted array of T containing only elements with rank >= deadline if Utils.biggerIsBetter(alg) is true, only elements with rank <= deadline if Utils.biggerIsBetter(alg) is false

      • checkSplits

        private static float checkSplits(java.lang.String s1,
                                 java.lang.String s2,
                                 java.lang.String[] splitters,
                                 ohi.andre.comparestring2.algs.interfaces.Algorithm algInstance,
                                 AlgMap.Alg alg)
        This method affects the overall performance of the comparison. You should choose carefully your splitters.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first String of the comparison
        s2 - the second String of the comparison
        splitters - each element of splitters will be used to perform a call to s2.split(element). Each element of the returned array will be compared to s1 using the provided algorithm. Then the value of the single best match (the biggest or the smallest, depending on alg) will be returned.
        algInstance - an instance of Algorithm that will be used to perform the comparison
        alg - an instance of AlgMap.Alg
        Returns:
        the value of the best match

      • normalize

        public static java.lang.String normalize(java.lang.String s)
        Parameters:
        s - the String you want to normalize
        Returns:
        s, lowercase, without accents, or similar weird characters
